Burglaries over the last 12 months are <h8>`r ifelse(burglaries_city$inc_prior3yearavgtolast12>=0," up"," down")` `r ifelse(burglaries_city$inc_prior3yearavgtolast12>=0,burglaries_city$inc_prior3yearavgtolast12,substring(burglaries_city$inc_prior3yearavgtolast12,2))`%</h8> compared to the annual average over the last three years.

The city averaged <h8>`r round(burglaries_city$last12mos/52,0)`</h8> burglaries a week over the last 12 months. In 2019, that number was <h8>`r round(burglaries_city$total19/52,0)`</h8> a week.

<subhead>A closer look at Raleigh burglaries neighborhood by neighborhood</subhead>

The risk is not the same neighborhood to neighborhood. ABC11's data team looked at the Raleigh Police Department's data by neighborhood from 2019 through `r format(asofdate, "%B %d, %Y")`.

The map color-codes each neighborhood by the burglary rate over the last 12 months. The three darker blues represent neighborhoods with burglary rates that are higher than the citywide rate. You can also click the box in the bottom right corner to see neighborhoods by the number of burglaries.

Click on any neighborhood on the map to see detailed numbers, rates and trends. You can also search for a street name, place, landmark or zip code.

<br>
```{r cars, echo=FALSE,out.width='100%',out.height='600'}
# burglary MAP

# Set bins for numbers of crimes for burglaries map
burglarybins1 <- c(0,
                100,
                250,
                350,
                450,
                600)
burglarybins2 <- c(0,
                50,
                100,
                150,
                200,
                300)
burglarypal1 <- colorBin(c("#aecfe6",
                             "#2787d6",
                             "#0058f6",
                             "#003ca6",
                             "#00215c"), burglaries_district$rate_last12, bins = burglarybins1,na.color = "#51585f")

burglarypal2 <- colorBin(c("#aecfe6",
                             "#2787d6",
                             "#0058f6",
                             "#003ca6",
                             "#00215c"), burglaries_district$last12mos, bins = burglarybins2,na.color = "#51585f")


# Create quick labels for burglaries map
burglarylabel <- paste(sep="",
                     "<popuptitle>",
                     burglaries_district$last12mos,
                     " burglaries </popuptitle><br>",
                     " in the last 12 months in the <b>",
                     burglaries_district$district_name,
                     "</b> police district, which includes the <b>",
                     burglaries_district$placename,
                     "</b> areas, home to an estimated ",
                     prettyNum(burglaries_district$population, big.mark=","),
                     " people.
<br>

# Creating police districts map for types of crimes
raleigh_burglary_map <- leaflet(burglaries_district, options = leafletOptions(zoomControl = FALSE, zoomSnap = 0.5, zoomDelta=0.5)) %>%
  htmlwidgets::onRender("function(el, x) {
L.control.zoom({ position: 'topright' }).addTo(this)
}") %>%
  setView(-78.65, 35.79, zoom = 11.5) %>% 
  addProviderTiles(provider = "CartoDB.Positron") %>%
  addPolygons(color = "white", 
              popup = burglarylabel,
              popupOptions = popupOptions(maxWidth ="200", 
                                          minWidth ="200"),
              weight = 2, 
              smoothFactor = 0.5,
              opacity = 0.6, 
              fillOpacity = 0.6,
              fillColor = ~burglarypal1(rate_last12),
              group="Rate") %>% 
    addPolygons(color = "white", 
              popup = burglarylabel,
              popupOptions = popupOptions(maxWidth ="200", 
                                          minWidth ="200"),
              weight = 2, 
              smoothFactor = 0.5,
              opacity = 0.6, 
              fillOpacity = 0.6,
              fillColor = ~burglarypal2(last12mos),
              group="Number") %>% 
    addSearchOSM(options = searchOptions(autoCollapse=FALSE, minLength = 3,zoom=13, position="topleft")) %>%
    onRender("function(el, x) {
        $('input.search-input')[0].placeholder = 'Search street, place or zip code'
        }") %>%
  addLegend(opacity = 0.6,
            values = burglaries_district$rate_last12, 
            pal = burglarypal1,
            position = "bottomleft", 
            title = paste(sep="","<popuptitle>Burglary Rate<br><popupchatter>Burglaries/100K people<br>Citywide: ",prettyNum(round(burglaries_city$rate_last12,0), big.mark=",")),
            group = "Rate",
            className = "info legend Rate") %>%
  addLegend(opacity = 0.6,
            values = burglaries_district$last12mos, 
            pal = burglarypal2,
            position = "bottomleft", 
            title = paste(sep="","<popuptitle>Burglaries<br><popupchatter>Total burglaries<br>Citywide: ",prettyNum(round(burglaries_city$last12mos,0), big.mark=",")),
            group = "Number",
            className = "info legend Number") %>%
  addLayersControl(
    baseGroups = c("Rate","Number"),
    options = layersControlOptions(collapsed = FALSE),
    position = 'bottomright') %>% hideGroup(c("Number")) %>%
   htmlwidgets::onRender("
      function(el, x) {
         var updateLegend = function () {
            var selectedGroup = document.querySelectorAll('input:checked')[0].nextSibling.innerText.substr(1);

            document.querySelectorAll('.legend').forEach(a => a.hidden=true);
            document.querySelectorAll('.legend').forEach(l => {
               if (l.classList.contains(selectedGroup)) l.hidden=false;
            });
         };
         updateLegend();
         this.on('baselayerchange', el => updateLegend());
      }"
   )
raleigh_burglary_map
```
